thread.title: Robbie Fulks, Brett Schneider in Steppenwolf's next round of 'LookOut'
thread.title_full: Robbie Fulks, Brett Schneider in Steppenwolf's next round of 'LookOut' - Chicago Tribune

author: Morgan Greene
title: Robbie Fulks, Brett Schneider in Steppenwolf's next round of 'LookOut'
text:
Steppenwolf Theatre Company announced another slate of new programming for "LookOut," the company’s year-round multi-genre performance series, on Thursday.
At the beginning of March is "Voices from the Dust Bowl" (March 5), a concert collaboration featuring Fifth House Ensemble and Henhouse Prowlers. Next, the Chicago comedy collective The Martin Luther Kings of Comedy will present their first television pilot, "The Revolution House!" (March 10-11). "Good Evening with Pat Whalen" (March 17), a satirical examination of the city of Chicago, follows.
"Communion: An Evening of Magic by Brett Schneider" (March 18-19) continues the series with two nights of interactive tricks with the Chicago actor and magician. Lavina Jadhwani and Margaret Baughman will direct "24WORDS — An Equal Rights Cabaret" (March 22), with book and lyrics by Charles Kouri, music by Gary Bragg and additional songs by Dean Schlabowske. Then "WRITE CLUB: Siege" (March 23-25) will bring its literary battles to the 1700. Closing out the month is a concert presentation of "The Jabez Country Opry" (March 30-31) by Mark Roberts, with music by Grammy nominee Robbie Fulks.
At the beginning of April, Matthew Santos, another Grammy nominee, and Chihsuan Yang will perform with special guest ESCP. And comedic musical trio Babe-alon 5 will perform "Martini Hour" April 3.
Performances take place in Steppenwolf’s 1700 Theatre, 1700 N Halsted St.
